intro: Celerina seyrigii, commonly known as the Seyrig's celerina, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is native to certain regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant features slender, branched stems and small, greenish-white flowers arranged in umbels. Its leaves are pinnately divided, contributing to its distinctive appearance. Celerina seyrigii is often found in grasslands and open woodlands, where it thrives in well-drained soils.
